data.title: Obstacles In Ray Charles Robinson's Life - 792 Words
data.text:
Ray Charles Robinson, better known as Ray Charles was a man of many talents. His musical talent is second to none, but his biggest talent of all is overcoming all the trials and tribulations in his life. Not only did he overcome them, he thrived from them. Ray Charles defeated four main obstacles in his life. These obstacles include, where he came from, the fact that he was blind, racial tension during the time of his being and the drug addiction that came along with the lifestyle that he lived. It’s amazing how he overcame these problems but it’s more fascinating to see how he did it. Ray Charles grew up in a small town in North Florida by the name of Greenville. Ray and his brother George, were raised by their biological mother Aretha, with …show more content…

Heroin controlled Ray’s life. The drug also controlled his relationships. He grew distant from his family so he could be more acclimated to the drug. It also got him in trouble with the law multiple times. Ray went into rehab to fix his addiction problems. Not only did he fix his problems he turned his life around and made hit after hit. He was inducted to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and won multiple Lifetime Achievement Awards. Ray Charles’s previous Rock and Roll life style caught up with him the year 2004. On June 10, 2004 Ray Charles died from liver disease complications at the age of seventy-three. These complications were brought on by mass amounts of alcohol he drank over his life and his previous use of heroin. Ray Charles overcame his struggles of coming from the middle of nowhere in probably one of the worst areas in the country to have his skin color and he became successful all while being blind. The way he came over all of his trials and tribulations is one of his best talents. I guess you could say he was pretty good at playing music
